result.execSummary:
The defendant William Anderson Jr. III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs waived by the court.  DNA surcharge and attorney's fees to be paid by payment plan at a rate of $50 per month commencing August 12th, 2022 and to be paid on the 12th of each month thereafter.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment entered in the amount of the unpaid balance.
Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
Firearm indicated in the Complaint (.380 Smith & Wesson) to be forfeitted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Anderson Jr. III

records.addlTxt: Payment plan due date summary and JOC mailed to defendant.

9:50 AM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant William Anderson Jr. III in court.  Attorney Nolan A. Jensen in court for William Anderson Jr. III.  Court examines Defendant as to submitted plea questionnaire.  Defendant enters a guilty plea.  Court accepts the plea, finding it to be free and voluntary, and finds the Defendant guilty as to their plea.  State as to sentencing.  Counsel as to sentencing.  Court renders judgment.
Filed by Atty Jensen (efiled @ 9:04 am)

records.addlTxt:
8:30 AM Set for Arraignment. Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant William Anderson Jr. III in court.  Defendant contacted some attorneys and cannot afford. Def requests to have a court appointed attorney and files petition for a court appointment.  Court does not find defendant to be indigent but will appoint counsel.
Arraignment scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Arraignment on April 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Not to possess any weapons.

12:05pm Defendant appears late for 8:15am hearing. Adam Gerol appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recalls case having previously issued an arrest warrant. Court advises of penalties and finds probable cause.  
12:07 PM Court will recall case for defendant to speak with public defender, who is present in court. 
12:08pm In session, defendant does not qualify for public defender.  Defendant will hire an attorney.  Court will withdraw the warrant that was issued earlier.
Arraignment scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.

9:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant William Anderson Jr. III not in court.  Court finds probable cause, based on non-appearance the court will issue warrant.
